Catalog Building Demonstration¶

This script is to be used with MUSE data.

It uses an object position catalog and a MUSE datacube to perform extended faint source detection on objects labelled lyman-alpha emitters. It aims at detecting Lyman-alpha haloes eventually present in their vicinity.

Needed : MUSE catalog (e.g. ‘Catalog_HDFS_v1p0.fits’ in the ./data folder) and HDFS datacube (e.g. ‘DATACUBE-HDFS-v1.24.fits’, to add in the ./data folder).

author:Jean-Baptiste Courbot - jean-baptiste.courbot@univ-lyon1.fr
date:november 18, 2015
demo_catalog.calcul_fwhm(lam)[source]¶

Full-Width at Half Maximum computation for the HDFS datacube. See Bacon et al., 2015, The MUSE 3D View of the Hubble Deep Field South.

Parameters:lam (float) – wavelength to perform the computation.
demo_catalog.extraire_cube(cube, coords_lya, S, W, marge_cube, allcube=False)[source]¶

Extract a subcube around the provided coordinates. May be replaced by MPFAD cube.subcube method, which provides square outputs fulled with NaNs if necessary.

Parameters:
  • cube (ndarray) – full datacube in which extraction is performed.
  • coords_lya (ndarray) – list of coordinates.
  • S (int) – spatial size of the subcube to extract.
  • W (int) – spectral length of the subcube to extract.
  • marge_cube (int) – margin to ignore in the total datacube.
  • allcube (bool) – define wether a subcube [False] or a cube slice [True] is extracted. If True, the cube is expected square.
